items.title: Canadian athletes on outside as Carney government's 1st budget sees no new sports funding
items.description: Canada’s summer and winter Olympians, along with other athletes, were left on the outside during Tuesday’s budget announcement by the federal government, despite a push in recent months by the Canadian Olympic Committee and national sport organizations for more resources.

items.title: Young people are facing a crisis of high unemployment. Here’s how the budget addresses that
items.description: Young people are facing high unemployment rates and struggling with a challenging labour market, and the government’s plan to address that includes more funding for summer job and work placement supports. But experts aren't sure that will be enough to alleviate the pressure of a challenging labour market.

items.title: Federal budget charts difficult path out of current crisis — with small margin of error
items.description: The 2025 federal budget plots a path for the Canadian economy to emerge from the current crisis. But it also highlights just how deep a hole the economy is in right now and how small the margin for error is as Canada navigates the perils of a trade war.

items.title: Governments Of Canada and Manitoba Strengthening Justice for Canada's First Responders
Calgary's mayor cautiously optimistic about federal budget as more details sought
items.description: Mayor Jeromy Farkas said the budget makes funding for municipalities a priority, but notes Calgarians will judge the budget on 'actions on the ground, not words on paper.'

items.title: Quebec government wants to restart talks with doctors over payment reform
items.description: Legault said Tuesday he wants to restart talks with doctors about the terms of his government's payment reform bill.

items.title: Budget promises to introduce framework for Canadian dollar-backed cryptocurrency
items.description: The Liberal government is committing to roll out new legislation to ensure some digital currencies are secure and stable enough for consumers and businesses to use.

items.title: Budget 2025: No commitment on emissions in Canada’s new climate strategy
items.description: The budget also doesn't mention possible incentive measures to encourage Canadians to lower their own emissions, such as reviving a subsidy for electric vehicle purchases.

items.title: Indigenous programs face $2.3B in cuts, some new money in Carney’s 1st budget
items.description: Indigenous programs face more than $2 billion in budget cuts but are being spared the worst of Ottawa’s proposed government-wide spending reductions in Mark Carney’s first budget as prime minister. In new money, Ottawa promises $2.3 billion over three years for safe water in First Nations.

items.title: Manitoba Government Expands Care for Dialysis Patients and Mothers in Norway House Cree Nation
Canada's immigration system is lost in the bushes
Get Ready for Harper-Style Public Service Cuts, Says Analyst
items.description: Budget 2025 proposes cutting 40,000 government jobs.

items.title: The Military Wins and Public Programs Lose in Carney’s Budget
items.description: But will the Liberals find enough support to survive a non-confidence vote?

items.title: Budget ushers in 'transformational' era for federal public service
Why should you care about the federal deficit?
items.description: The federal deficit is a common flashpoint in Canadian politics. Is it really such a big deal? And how much should you worry about it?

items.title: Power outages, closures plague Westside Road as burned trees fall on power lines
items.description: 'The weekend of October 24th to 27th, the Wilson’s Landing and north area had power outages anywhere from 23 to 35 hours — all within a 54-hour period,' said resident Blanche Beda.

items.title: Andrew Rosenfeldt's aunt takes the stand during Day 11 of 2nd-degree murder trial
items.description: Rosenfeldt’s aunt said she heard a loud bang the night Nykera Brown died during the 11th day of his second-degree murder trial at Saskatoon Court of King's Bench Tuesday.

items.title: Canola and food exports: What Budget 2025 proposes as trade war continues
items.description: The Liberal government is promising new supports for canola farmers and other sectors hit by U.S. and international tariffs in the federal budget released Tuesday.

items.title: St. Mary's fish plant destroyed by fire as crews face hurricane-force winds in N.L.
items.description: The fish plant in the Newfoundland community of St. Mary's has burned to the ground as the community faces hurricane force winds and heavy rain, Mayor Steve Ryan told CBC News Tuesday night.

items.title: City of Kelowna hopes for provincial approval to ease restrictions on short-term rentals
items.description: Council also passed a resolution to try and lobby the province to fast-track the process and exemption as a final approval would not be granted until November 2026.

items.title: Waves could reach 12 metres high on N.L. south coast as heavy winds, rain persist
items.description: CBC meteorologist Ashley Brauweiler warns of a storm surge from the Burin Peninsula to the southern Avalon that could bring waves as high as 12 metres breaking along the shore.

items.title: UCP brought back corporate donations to parties, then took in $471K in three months
items.description: Injury lawyers opened their wallets to support the United Conservative Party, while their fight against auto insurance reforms continues.

items.title: Ontario town could soon own former WWII-era POW camp, but cost a concern
items.description: The future of Camp 30, a former prisoner of war camp in Ontario, is up in the air despite an offer for the municipality of Clarington to take on the remaining land and buildings.

items.title: Budget 2025: Ottawa to slash foreign aid spending to pre-pandemic levels
items.description: The budget talks of "leveraging innovative tools, while focusing support for countries that need it the most" and rejigging existing agreements with specific countries.

items.title: The Beaches make a play for Canadian rock royalty at Doug Mitchell
items.description: The Beaches are making more than just waves.

items.title: Infants Bear the Brunt of RSV Hospitalizations, UBC Study Finds
items.description: Researchers say the province should do more to protect the very small and vulnerable.

items.title: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigns from Conservative caucus to join the Liberals
items.description: Nova Scotia MP Chris d'Entremont resigned from the Conservative caucus Tuesday — and he's joining the Liberals.
